channel.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
channel.description:
Well, I just finished Fable: The Lost Chapters and now I crave for more! I just loved it, and I felt sad after I killed Jack Of Blades because I couldn't continue. But this has reintroduced me to RPG's, and I was wondering: do you know any similar games? And don't say diablo, because IIRC that was a point and click game, and that sucks. And it sucks graphically, too. The camera is way to far from the character. I want to move the character with the keyboard. Fable II would be ideal, but that would mean me buying a 360 and I don't have the money for it atm. From what I've read, Fable 1 is the same as the first part of Fable: TLC. So feed me!@
Edit: I just found out that you can actually continue playing, I just have to watch the credits.

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’ll download it tomorrow. There is one available on the dutch newsservers, but my providers retention sucks so I have to pay so I can dl it.

Read full topic

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Oblivion would do it then.

Although Fallout 3 isn’t so close to now. It’s style is really far back, with a few things from today.

Read full topic

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

When I play an rpg, I want it to be in medieval times. So Fallout 3 won’t do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Oblivion or Fallout 3?
Consider them the same game, different scenarios.

Maps are pretty equal I think.

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The map is fucking huge too, right? I’m getting all exited already, and I haven’t even downloaded it yet. First I have to format my external hdd, and that takes ages

Read full topic

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yeah Oblivion is great in that expansive part.
Kinda hard to think of others.
Fallout 3, basically Oblivion with guns.

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

It looks quite epic, some people say they’ve played more then 100 hours and still aren’t finished. I’ll try it once it comes available on the dutch usenet again.

More suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

you can get third person in oblivion you can change the camera position there is a lack of cutscenes but the storys are epic

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Oblivion is first person right?

What I want:

Third person
Keyboard movement
Camere close to character and not an aerial(sp?) view.
Good story line.
Cutscenes.

You might say justfuckinggoogleit, but if you don’t know titles of games, you can’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Yes, Oblivion is my one true love. Although Fable was amazing as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Fable TLC: I WUNT MOAR@!
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yeah Fable 2 was excellent.

In terms of RPGs, there’s a ton.
As far as them being similar to Fable, you might be out of luck. There aren’t many.
